content:
It is possible to interpret the lyrics of "California Girls" in different ways, and it is ultimately up to the listener to decide how to interpret them. However, based on the context of the song and the lyrics themselves, it seems more likely that the Beach Boys are making an appeal for diversity in their desire for all girls to be "California girls."

The lyrics of the song celebrate the diversity of girls from different parts of California, describing them as "cool, [and] breezy," "warm, [and] sweet," and "sharp as a tack." The refrain of "I wish they all could be California girls" could be interpreted as a wish that all girls could be as diverse and unique as the girls described in the song.

Additionally, the song includes lyrics such as "I wish they all could be California" and "The west coast has the sunshine and the girls all get so tanned," which suggest that the Beach Boys are celebrating the diversity and uniqueness of California and the people who live there.

Overall, it seems more likely that the Beach Boys are making an appeal for diversity rather than a homogenous society in the lyrics of "California Girls."
